intro: Blephariglottis ciliaris, commonly known as the silver hair vine, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a silvery or hairy appearance, giving it its common name. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its delicate foliage and showy flowers.
